articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike hit a tent inside a hospital compound in central Gaza, killing at least five people, bringing the total of Palestinians killed on Sunday to 19, Gaza health officials said, after another round of talks ended without result.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill five at hospital, Gaza officials say, after abortive talks

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Protesting students in Bangladesh have called for a march to the capital Dhaka on Monday in defiance of a nationwide curfew to press Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to resign, a day after deadly clashes in the South Asian country killed nearly 100 people.
articles.title: Bangladesh protest: Students call for march to force PM to quit

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: Ukrainian pilots have started flying F-16s for operations within the nation, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday, confirming the long-awaited arrival of the U.S.-made fighter jets more than 29 months since Russia's invasion.
articles.title: Ukraine finally deploying F-16 fighter jets, says Zelenskiy

articles.author: Asif Shahzad
articles.description: Pakistan's jailed former prime minister, Imran Khan, who blames the military for his ouster and 12-month-old imprisonment on what he calls trumped-up charges, said on Sunday it would be "foolish" not to have "excellent" relations with the army.
articles.title: Exclusive: Jailed Pakistan ex-PM Imran Khan: Would be 'foolish' not to have good relations with army

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police arrested dozens of people after protests across parts of England and Northern Ireland turned violent on Saturday, as the government pledged tough action against those it said were exploiting the murder of three girls to stir up disorder.
articles.title: Dozens arrested after UK protests turn violent in wake of child murders

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversaw the delivery of a new tactical ballistic missile system to troops on Sunday, state media KCNA reported on Monday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim oversees delivery of new tactical ballistic missile launchers

articles.author: Doina Chiacu
articles.description: The United States is deploying additional military might in the Middle East as a defensive measure with a goal of de-escalating tensions in the region, a White House official said on Sunday.
articles.title: US says moves in Middle East are defensive, goal is deterrence

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia on Monday raised its terror threat level to "probable" from "possible", citing an increase in extremist views in the country leading to a more than 50% chance of the planning of an onshore attack in the next 12 months.
articles.title: Australia raises terror threat level to 'probable' from 'possible'

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: The far-right favourites to win Austria's next election have forged an alliance with Hungarian leader Viktor Orban that could deepen defiance of Brussels and threaten already fragile consensus over the Ukraine war if they take power.
articles.title: Resurgent far-right conjures Austria-Hungary headache for EU on Ukraine

articles.author: Rich Mckay
articles.description: Hurricane Debby is expected to slam into the Big Bend region of Florida's Gulf Coast by midday on Monday before slowly crossing the state, causing potentially dangerous storm surges and catastrophic flooding, the National Hurricane Center (NHC) said.
articles.title: Hurricane Debby takes aim at Florida's Gulf Coast, expected to slog up East Coast
